Though these folk have been forced to sell their skills to wealthy nobles to make ends meet, old pride still sleeps in their breasts.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm out of a job, so I don't\nhave anything to spare.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Continued lack of employ\nhas lightened my wallet,\nso...sure.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["An unemployed maid looking for work. Peel back the facade, however, and her true identity is that of a spy for the United Kingdom of Triblia. She moves far too quickly and far too quietly for a simple servant; she can appear beside you without making a single sound... Unfortunately, she's so terrible at her professed occupation that she can't keep a job for more than a week or two.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A woman in search of her runaway husband. Though she seems quiet and soft-spoken at first, she is actually quite forceful and tried to control her husband's every move. Her time in this town has given her time to think, and she's decided that she'll give her husband more free rein when he returns home with her.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A painter famous throughout the continent for her skill. She works on commissions for the rich and powerful, painting spectacular secular works that earn applause from her wealthy patrons. On the sly, she sneaks satire of stratified society into her paintings—an irony that few are sharp enough to appreciate.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A young sentry tasked with guarding the palace. Dutiful to a fault, he has never once been late to work or dozed off on the job. The recent unrest in town led him to question whether the ruling class was worth serving. However, when he learned that similar conflicts were tearing the continent apart, he decided his services as a defender of order were needed now more than ever.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A former miner promoted to the post of taskmaster. The death of Lord Scarabe has caused the price of gold dust to plummet. To compensate for this reduction in profits, he's working his miners harder and with greater cruelty.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A priest of the Order of the Sacred Flame. He is a true believer in his faith's tenets of equality, and eagerly proselytizes his cause. This has generated him much enmity from the nobles of the highly stratified society of Sufrataljah. Recently, he has been approached by miners plotting revolution, and is troubled by how he should handle this revelation.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A man who cares deeply for his daughter Meryl, his pride and joy, and is always the first to rush to her side in times of need. In truth, Meryl is not his child by birth, a fact which the poor man does not have the heart to share...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['After the Great Pestilence claimed her parents at an early age, this young girl was raised by her elder brother, Zeph, whom she loves and adores. She still has a tendency to act like a fawning child in his presence.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A loving mother who cares for her daughter more than anything in the world. She is always there to encourage Meryl whenever she loses heart. In truth, they are not related by blood, but their bonds run even deeper than that of family.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Friends with Nina since childhood, the two have grown up like sisters. Whenever they're in trouble, they go running to talk to the nice apothecary man.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A resident of Clearbrook who enjoys everything about her home from the quiet river and warm sunshine to its kindhearted people. But every so often she gets the sinking feeling that she doesn't belong.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['This culinarian uses only the finest local fish to make simple fare that is beloved by all. People are beginning to flock to his establishment every day to enjoy what some have called the true taste of Clearbrook.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A blacksmith who frets over how to run his shop. He's recently received high quality equipment from a merchant friend, but has difficulty selling weapons in such a peaceful village. ['A girl who lives with her grandfather. She has adored stories of his worldly travels ever since she was little and hopes to visit those places with him while he is yet able.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Oh, that sounds wonderful.\nPlease, take me along!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['An old man who lives with his granddaughter. He enjoys telling her his vivid recollections of a "goddess of the spring" he met in his youth. He hopes to take her there someday.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I'm just an old fool.\nI do hope I can be of help.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A spirited and sociable young resident of Clearbrook. Despite his perennial frown and endless string of complaints about his fellow villagers, it's no secret that in truth, he cares quite deeply about one and all.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A spirited and sociable young resident of Clearbrook. ['A middle-aged bartender who comes from another town. He built a dancing stage in an effort to revitalize the village, but it was not as popular as he had hoped. He may return to his hometown if it ends up being an utter failure.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["This is a small village.\nOnce I spread some good\nrumors, it'll be right as rain.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['The strongest woman in the village—a fact in which she takes tremendous pride. Word of her physical prowess has spread far and wide, inviting invitations of marriage from equally formidable men. However, the only invitations she cares to entertain are from challengers seeking to test their might against hers.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You want to try your\nhand against me, too?\nThen ready yourself!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That was a good match.\nLet me know when you're\nup for another.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['We should spar again sometime!\nUntil then, take this.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["That was a good match.\nLet me know when you're\nup for another.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I think I could learn a lot\nfrom fighting alongside you!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A young new apothecary of Clearbrook, Zeph lost his parents to the Great Pestilence at an early age, and thereafter had to care for his sister, Nina, by himself. As she is his sole surviving family, he feels this responsibility keenly, and has resolved to place her welfare above his own.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A young new apothecary of Clearbrook, Zeph lost his parents to the Great Pestilence at an early age, and thereafter had to care for his sister, Nina, by himself. His best friend is also an apothecary, and they have a bit of a friendly rivalry going.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I need to hone my skills\nas an apothecary so I'm\nnot outmatched.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['This old woman was carried to Clearbrook by the whim of fate, much like the waters of the river she watches over. Perhaps she hopes that, in time, it will cleanse her of a lifetime of sin—of banditry, of murder, of worse. Or perhaps she seeks only to live out her days in quiet damnation.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Do I know how to fight?\nWhy don't you come over\nhere and find out?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I think it's time somebody\ntaught you a lesson!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm starting to like you.\nHere, you can have this.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I think it's time somebody\ntaught you a lesson!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A guard who keeps an eye out for bandit attacks, which have been on the rise what with all the wars recently. He'd never admit as much, but he's concerned about the village's ability to defend itself, given that there are few able-bodied warriors here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A guard who keeps an eye out for bandit attacks, which have been on the rise what with all the wars recently. He's concerned about the village's ability to defend itself, so he's taken to training himself even harder.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["You're incredibly strong.\nPlease, allow me to accompany you.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A woman born and raised in Clearbrook, who inherited the inn that's been in her family for generations. Their freshly baked bread is famous throughout the village, and one can still catch its heavenly scent every morning to this very day.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A proud son of Clearbrook, this fisherman reads the winds and the waters like an educated man his letters, and could bring home a king's bounty every day if he saw fit. ["A proud son of Clearbrook, this fisherman reads the winds and the waters like an educated man his letters, and could bring home a king's bounty every day if he saw fit.\n\nRecently he's become concerned about how driftwood comes floating down the river like clockwork every day.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Hey! Didja think I wouldn't\nnotice what yer tryin' to do!?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["It looks like I'm the one\nwho's bein' reeled in...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A devoted connoisseur of Magg's cuisine who has eaten every dish on the menu. No other fare can seem to satisfy his cravings, and in recent days he hardly ever eats at home, earning him many complaints from his family.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A devoted connoisseur of Magg's cuisine who has eaten every dish on the menu. No other fare can seem to satisfy his cravings, and in recent days he's taken to bringing it home with him, mending his relationship with his family.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["These days, I've been taking Magg's\nfood home with me, so...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Is there food as good as Magg's\nin other towns? I'll have to bring\nit home to my family!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Some deeds can't be washed away.\nTake care out there.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["As a minstrel searching for a champion to extol, he wandered the continent until he finally stumbled into Donescu. There, he witnessed the gallant form of King Dudek courageously striding into almost certain death, and was struck with inspiration—here indeed was a hero worthy of song! Though the king perished, this bard remains, composing ballads to the king's nobility and strength.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Here! Go, and remember\nthe king's mighty deeds!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Let us tell the world of\nKing Dudek's great deeds!\nHail King Dudek! Hail!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A priest dispatched here from the cathedral in Saintsbridge, he bemoaned his assignment to Donescu as a demotion in all but name. The invasion of the Westerlings changed all that, however, and now he believes it was the Sacred Flame itself that guided him here. Since this holy revelation, he's thrown himself into his duties with relentless fervor.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Please, take it with the\nblessing of the Sacred Flame.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['My purpose here is not yet complete.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I understand.\nLet the Sacred Flame light our path.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A young girl living in the corner of town. Always off in her own little dreamland, she's had trouble making friends her own age and her parents are worried sick about her. The town may be falling apart around her, but even now she waits for the friend who once played with her to return.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["An old woman dressed in rags who stumbles about town, shouting about calamities yet to come. This earned her sour looks and a poor reputation—until the armies of the G'roha appeared at their doorstep. Now, she's treated with awe, respect, and not an inconsiderable amount of fear.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The stars tell me that\nyou cannot have it!\nYou cannot!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I foretold that this day would come!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The stars tell me not\nto follow! They do!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['The stars have shown me\nthat I must go where you lead.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['This old warhorse has been a mercenary for many a season, and has the skills to show for it. Unfortunately, he feels restless without a bottle in hand, and so he spends his days and nights in whatever tavern will take him. He planned to wield his beloved axe against the Westerlings, but he always drinks himself under a table before he can get out the door.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Interested in my axe arm?\nYou're different from the\nlily-livered lot around here.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Ahh, my head's clearin'.\nCheap booze just won't\ndo it anymore... *hic*", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["An axe's like a bottle of ale, see?\nDon't swing it 'round willy-nilly.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I won't lose to you.\nNot in a duel of strength,\nor a drinkin' contest.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Call me when you need my axe.\nI'll be drinkin' till then.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A fisherman who made a peaceful living catching fish in the river and selling them at market. He lost his beloved wife in a battle with G'roha, and now spends his days standing amidst the ruins of his town.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You're here to take what\nlittle's left from me, aren't you!?", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I won't give it to you!\nIf I do, I'll have nothing left...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've lost it all now...\nForgive me, my love...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Oh. I see now. If I follow you,\nI can make those bastards pay!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A scholar recording the history of the war against G'roha and the fate of those left in its wake. The locals view him as compassionless for these efforts, but he is in fact driven by great empathy. He hopes that recording the horrors that unfolded here will prevent future generations from repeating the same mistakes. He grits his teeth when insults are flung his way and continues his thankless task.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've learned more from history\nthan mere academic facts.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Plunder follows war.\nThat is merely the way of things.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['If you truly want it, you may have it.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I learn from history so as not to\nrepeat the mistakes of the past.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I have finished my research here.\nIt is time to move on to the next town.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A compassionate woman born to a wealthy noble family. Though her home and fortune were spared the ravages of war, seeing the damage her town endured caused her to be stricken by a sense of powerlessness. Discovering reserves in herself she didn't know she had, she soon wiped away her tears and stood up with fierce determination in her eyes. Her newfound goal is to grow strong enough to protect those she cares for.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I will fight, and I will fight...\nand I will grow strong!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I do not have the strength yet to fight...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I will go with you to learn the ways of war.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A young soldier of Donescu, he joined the army because he heard the pay was good. The problem is, he hates violence and thinks it'd be simpler for everyone to just surrender without a fight. He spent the entirety of the war against G'roha hiding.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["If you want it, you've got to\nshow me you're serious.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm a soldier of Donescu.\nWe're a tough lot.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Finally, I can leave this town!\nGoodbye, Donescu!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A soldier hailing from a nearby village, he's had the eyes of an eagle since he was a boy. Employed by the army as a lookout, he was the first to notice the G'roha battleship on the horizon. Sharp eyes couldn't reveal just how fearsome a foe they would prove themselves to be.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Lookouts are often first to fight!\nWe're no pushovers!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll accompany you as sentry and scout!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A weather-beaten soldier who has served Donescu since the reign of the previous king. Hardworking and loyal to a fault, King Dudek placed great trust in him, offering him a promotion, which he refused. This career soldier wished to remain a simple guard, protecting his town shoulder to shoulder with its people. Even now that Donescu has been ravaged by war, this desire remains unshaken.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A weather-beaten soldier who has served Donescu since the reign of the previous king. In his heart, he blames himself for not protecting the city, but knows that if the populace sees their protectors moping it will only dispirit them further. Thus, despite his sense of guilt, he strides through the city, back ramrod straight, projecting an aura of safety and security.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Let me show you how a\ntrue son of Donescu fights!', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Come back when you have\nmore steel in your spine.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I believe you will use this honorably.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["You won't survive on\nthe battlefield like that!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I can't protect my city as I am...\nso I must see this as a chance\nto hone my skills.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A soldier possessed by rage. Overly confident in his skills, defeat at the hands of the Westerlings left him fuming and indignant. He believes that if he was only a little stronger they could have achieved victory, and this frustration mercilessly drives him down the path of vengeance.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['Damn...\nIf only I had fought like this\nagainst the barbarians...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'll follow you to the ends of the earth!", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["Young though she may be, Roberta is widely looked up to as the leader of the harlots of Donescu. She'll never abandon a friend and never back down from a fight—even from the most vicious thugs and ne'er-do-wells. Respected, admired, loved, and feared, she's matron to all under her care. From the shadows, she does her best to support the struggling women of the war-torn kingdom.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I have a soft spot for tough people.\nSo, where to?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A member of an organization that operates in Donescu's shadowy underbelly. Inability to conform to society's standards was what set him down the criminal path, but he loves his hometown as much as any upstanding citizen. When the Westerlings came, he gladly volunteered his specialized skills to aid those fleeing the violence. Now, he works hard alongside his fellows to restore the city.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A member of an organization that operates in Donescu's shadowy underbelly. Inability to conform to society's standards was what set him down the criminal path, but he loves his hometown and did all he could to help restore it. His hard work earned accolades not just from his shady colleagues, but from lawful folk as well. Today, he's loved by many as an essential cornerstone of Donescu society.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I ain't gonna let an amateur\nlike you mess with me.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["I've gotta set a good example\nfor my underlings, y'know.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Okay, okay, I get it,\nyou're tougher than me.\nI'll help you out.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["An elderly apothecary who spent his years traveling the land, healing the sick and wounded. Several years ago he suffered a grave injury and lost the use of one of his arms, and so he set out for Donescu to settle into a quiet retirement. He'd only just put down roots when G'roha showed up, and now he is tormented by his inability to help those suffering around him.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['An elderly apothecary who spent his years traveling the land, healing the sick and wounded. He suffered a grave injury several years ago and lost the use of one of his arms, and ended up in Donescu just in time to get mixed up in the carnage. He was tormented by his inability to help those wounded in battle, but when he discovered that his knowledge could aid where his arm could not, he began searching for people to pass his skills on to.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I believe you're the\nright person to have this.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What good can I do as a\ndecrepit, one-armed apothecary?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['You think I can still help people?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["A merchant who traveled here anticipating a massive demand for goods now that the war has wound down. However, when confronted by the horrors left in the wake of the fighting, he resolved to share his merchandise with the unfortunate for free. Though he's got a sharp eye for commerce, he's well aware that his good nature is preventing him from making a fortune.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["Those with ample leaves shouldn't\nplay tight with their purse strings.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'm pouring all my profits\ninto the reconstruction effort.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I can't leave this place.\nThe people here need\nthe supplies I can provide.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I see you're in a bind,\nso I'll help you out.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A boy who lost his family when the Westerlings attacked. With the town overrun and many of the adults wandering around in a daze, he realized the only one he could truly count on was himself. Spurred by tragedy, he resolved to become someone who could get by on wits alone—a merchant.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A man who puts the "common" in "commonfolk." He\'s a third-generation resident of this town who worked an average job doing nothing out of the ordinary. He married a local girl and was busy raising kids when the war turned his everyday life upside-down. Grievously wounded and his family gone, he no longer has any idea of how to face his cruel new reality. How can one live after everything has been taken from them?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I have memories attached to this.\nI can't give it away.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['What? What will you take from me next?', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["There's only misery left for me here, anyway...", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

["An ex-soldier turned ferryman, he retired from the army when he realized he had no talent for fighting. He'd been ashamed of this decision until he began helping crowds of refugees escape the fighting by ferrying them to safety. The sight of him maneuvering his craft through the chaos of war, unbent and undaunted, gave courage to the terrified townsfolk.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['I was just looking for someone\nto take this off my hands.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
['And so I set sail on a new adventure...', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']

['A fugitive who used the confusion of war to slip out of his jail cell. Though he is a hardened criminal who has committed every evil deed in the book, when he saw the carnage left upon the town, regret for his past misdeeds welled up from within him. He immediately set to work helping those in need, yet remains keenly aware that it will never absolve him of his sins.', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I've just made it outside.\nI don't have anything to give.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
["I'd been hiding this on me\nfor a while, but...here, have it.", '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '', '']
